channel.title: A little bit help please
channel.description:
i am planning to lears some java language...
and some friends told me they would learn me but first they have me some tasks to see if i am able to look on the internet for answers to my questions...
first they told me to make a private static int. (with a value)
i made this...
[code]Private Static Int = Dizzy = 1;[/code] (dizzy is a name of a friend)
Now they asked me to make a public void with that int. and duplicate the value with 1.( it neds to be closed with brackets and such)
How do you do that ?? cuz i realy want to learn java.
Then they asked me some questions about the basics...
They asked me::
What dous a Int means?
What dous a String means?
What dous a void means ?
What dous a Bolean means ?
i am now looking for those answers and i cannot find them right away :'(
I was hoping you guys could help meh...
Greetz: joery

item.title: A little bit help please
item.dc:creator: @mod_joery joery
item.description:
@mod_joery wrote:

thanks guys…

I might ned some more help then i’l post

Read full topic

item.title: A little bit help please
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“semaphore, post:4, topic:33922”]To start off, a book is worth a million posts.

Read this.

I actually have a book from Ivor dealing with VC++. The best way to learn something is to read about it and immerse yourself in it.[/quote]

You can’t just tell a kid to go off and spend $50 on a book when the resources any decently motivated person need are available for free on the internet. A book is the best option, but for the cash-strapped, Sun offers this.

Read full topic

item.title: A little bit help please
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

private static int Dizzy = 1;

Read full topic

item.title: A little bit help please
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

int is short for integer, which is any whole number, positive or negative
String is a squence of characters, and example is “hello world!”
void means, nothing, if you make a subroutine and dont want it to return anything, make the return value void
boolean means true or false, it only has two values, it can be set to logical conditons, 5==a will return true if a is 5, false if a is anything else

for that public void thing, you havent explained very well, im guessing he wants a subroutine, but i dont know how to do that with something which returns void, im quite sure that subroutines cannot access global variables

Private Static Int = Dizzy = 1;

this wont compile, it has to be like this

Private Static Int Dizzy = 1;

Read full topic
